meanings.definition: Broken into small parts or pieces
meanings.sent1: The puzzle lay on the floor, fragmented into tiny bits.
meanings.sent2: The glass shattered, leaving a fragmented mess on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked so fragmented after the kids got to it!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts felt as fragmented as a shattered mirror.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was deliberately fragmented to create a unique effect.

meanings.sent1: The old map was so fragmented that it was hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: His memory of the event was fragmented, with gaps in between.
meanings.sent3: The story he told was so fragmented, it sounded like a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Their communication was so fragmented, it was like talking to different people.
meanings.sent5: The plan seemed so fragmented that it was bound to fail.
